title: Type ID please
content:
Anyone know this font?

thanks!!

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Screen Shot 2013-02-01 at 9.31.32 AM.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015183843/http:/typophile.com/files/Screen%20Shot%202013-02-01%20at%209.31.32%20AM.png) | 206.58 KB |
author: martipoirier

comments.content: I don't know the original name of this typeface. BTW, this artwork is a [poster by Anthony Burrill for The Typographic Circle](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015183843/http:/www.typocircle.com/archive/poster/anthony-burrill). I have only similars: [Goodfellow](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015183843/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/solotype/goodfellow/), [Gans Modern](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015183843/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/intellecta/gans-lath-modern/), [MacBeth](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015183843/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/macbeth/), [Excelsis](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015183843/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/solotype/excelsis/), [Rubens](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015183843/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/woodentypefonts/rubens/)
Also in the same vein - [Jordan Davies' William Page 500](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015183843/http:/www.woodentypefonts.com/Pages/wmpg500.html)

> [http://www.typocircle.com/archive/poster/anthony-burrill](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015183843/http:/www.typocircle.com/archive/poster/anthony-burrill "http://www.typocircle.com/archive/poster/anthony-burrill")

"his now trademark technique for direct communication and an uncomplicated style which stems from his appreciation for simplicity."

That must explain why some of the letters are horribly clotted, in fact leading to _less_ "simplicity"... Making letterforms look simple is no job for a typographic simpleton.

hhp
